table.name: form_of_writing
table.Comment: Defines the actual scribe of of sign. As actual scribe the scribe as person using at the very moment a special „font“ caused by the mood the scribe is in (conecentrated, sloppy, fast and furious) and the used equipment. Thus even change of quills or the status of a quill (fresh filled, new, old) could be distinguished.

table.name: image_to_edition_catalog
table.Comment: Temporary table to link image catalog info with edition info until the SQE_image table is fully populated. Once that table is populated this one will become redundant.

table.name: position_in_stream
table.Comment: Put signs in one-dimensional stream (≈ text) The reason for this table is, that the manuscripts may contain parallel text-streams created by corrections. Sometimes also scholars put superlinear signs at different places. Thus, this is a discrete layer of interpretation between signs and words.

table.name: real_char_area
table.Comment:
Contains data to define a real space on a reference-image (a master-image, to which all other images are mapped)
we have to discuss the unique identifier of the reference image

table.name: sign_char_reading_data
table.Comment: Contains a possible content for a given char place (char, space,vacat, meta-sign)

table.name: word
table.Comment: A collection of signs from a stream

index.name: unique_edition_entry
index.ColNames: edition_location_1 edition_location_2 edition_name edition_side edition_volume composition

key.name: unique_edition_entry
key.ColNames: edition_location_1 edition_location_2 edition_name edition_side edition_volume composition

column.name: position_in_stream_id
column.Comment: References a sign in a stream

column.name: values_set
column.Comment: If true, then the are_in_scroll and rotation are set by the user and must not be affected by the automatic placing of the system

column.name: readable_areas
column.Comment:
2x4-field set to locate readable areas can be used to set brackets in a more sophisticated way
NW NE MNW MNE MSW MSE SW SE
